alert.note: Alert for Marion; Wetzel (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 07 at 1:45PM EDT until August 07 at 4:45PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pittsburgh has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Marion County in northern West Virginia... Southern Wetzel County in northern West Virginia... * Until 445 PM EDT. * At 145 PM EDT, local law enforcement reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Fairmont, Mannington, Pleasant Valley, Winfield, Barrackville, Monongah, Pine Grove, Fairview, Jacksonburg, Rivesville, Grant Town, Farmington, Worthington, Smithfield, Grangeville, Rachel, Curtisville, Metz, Carolina and Idamay. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
